Package school

Class SchoolPeriod

java.lang.Object
school.SchoolPeriod
public class SchoolPeriod extends Object
Represents the concept of a block of time during the school year defined by the json file. This "block of time" can include:
  • Scheduled academic classes
  • Special blocks (e.g. lunch, study hall)
  • Non-significant, "filler" blocks (e.g. passing period, before classes, after classes)

Each period has a start and end time defined to the nearst millisecond of precision as UTCTime objects. For any period P_(n) that is not the first or last period in the school year, the following must be true:

  • P_(n).start < P_(n).end. That is, the minimum length of a period is 1 millisecond.
  • P_(n).end = P_(n + 1).start + 1 ms. That is, no point exists in the exclusive interval between the start and end of the school year where there is a gap of >= 1 ms.

The properties of a SchoolPeriod object are defined by the "Type" filed. The options of this field are defined in more detail in the documentation for this class's constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • SchoolPeriod

      public SchoolPeriod(String type, String name, UTCTime start, UTCTime end, boolean isLast)
      Constructs a new SchoolPeriod object from the information in the school json file.

      The "type" of a period is defined by the following:

      • "Nothing": this period is non-significant filler. It should not be counted by isCounted and does not contain an educational class (isFree == true).
      • "Special": this period has an important event other than an academic class.
      • An integer n such that n >= FirstPeriod && n <= LastPeriod. This identified the number of an academic class which should be counted and is not free.
      Parameters:
      type - the "type" of the period. See above for more detail.
      name - the name of the period.
      start - the start time of the period.
      end - the end time of the period.
      isLast - whether this period is the last in its containing day (local time).
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is not "Nothing", "Special", or an integer.

      public boolean isCounted()
      Returns whether this period is counted. A "counted" period is one whose type is not "Nothing".
      Returns:
      whether this period is counted.

    • isFree

      public boolean isFree()
      Returns whether this period is free. A "free" period is one whose type is not an integer.
      Returns:
      whether this period is free.
